description: Erection of a roof extension including a part front roof extension with one roof window, a two storey side and part two storey rear extension, a single storey rear extension and creation of a basement, following demolition of the existing side and side and rear extension to the house
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [2114-DR-01-00-P0, 2114-DR-01-01-P0, 2114-DR-01-02-P0, 2114-DR-01-03-P0, 2114-DR-01-04-P0, 2114-DR-01-05-P0, 2114-DR-01-06-P0, 2114-DR-01-07-P0, 2114-DR-01-08-P0, 2114-DR-01-09-P0, 2114-DR-01-10-P0, 2114-DR-02-00-P1, 2114-DR-02-01-P1, 2114-DR-02-02-P1, 2114-DR-02-03-P1, Daylight & Sunlight Report, Arboricultural Impact Assessment 200236-PD-21, Flood Risk and SuDs Assessment with appendix. Received: 9/2/2024; 2114-DR-02-06-P1. Received: 22/4/2024; 2114-DR-02-04-P1, 2114-DR-02-05-P0, 2114-DR-02-07-P1, 2114-DR-02-08-P1, 2114-DR-02-09-P1, 2114-DR-02-10-P1 and 2114-DR-02-11-P1. Received: 26/4/2024].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.
Condition : 4 - The basement hereby permitted shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.
Reason: In order to ensure that adequate living standards are maintained and to protect neighbours' living conditions.
Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until a Construction Method Statement (CMS) relating to the basement hereby approved has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority. The CMS shall be certified by a qualified professional and give details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area. The approved CMS shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.
Condition : 6 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public. 
Condition : 7 - The roof area of the rear extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' privacy
Condition : 8 - The basement and extensions hereby permitted shall be built in line with flood management measures as shown in the submitted and hereby approved Flood Risk Assessment.
Reason: In order to protect the occupiers from flooding.
Condition : 9 - The trees that are specified on the drawings hereby approved to be retained shall be protected according to the submitted Arboricultural Impact Assessment 200236-PD-21 and throughout the course of the development by methods that conform to the best practice guidance contained in British Standard BS5837: 2012 or any guidance that shall have superseded it.
